It is characterized by its unique, elongated leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a subtle visual appeal to its habitat. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Amberboa maroofii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
